Package com.github.tadukoo.database.mysql

Class Database

java.lang.Object
com.github.tadukoo.database.mysql.Database
public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
A class used to connect to a MySQL database and make queries, updates, etc. to it.
Version:
0.1-Alpha-SNAPSHOT
Author:
Logan Ferree (Tadukoo)

  • Method Details

    • connect

      private java.sql.Connection connect() throws java.sql.SQLException
      Creates a Connection to a MySQL database with the url and login information that was set in the constructor of this Database class.
      Returns:
      The Connection that's been created
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • execute

      public <ResultType> ResultType execute​(com.github.tadukoo.util.functional.function.ThrowingFunction<java.sql.Connection,​ResultType,​java.sql.SQLException> transaction) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Runs a SQL transaction. Will attempt MAX_ATTEMPTS times until it works, before throwing a SQLException if it doesn't work in that many attempts.
      Type Parameters:
      ResultType - The type of result to be returned
      Parameters:
      transaction - The transaction function to run
      Returns:
      The result from the transaction function
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • executeQuery

      public <ResultType> ResultType executeQuery​(DBUtil.Query<ResultType> query) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Executes a sql query and returns the result from it.
      Type Parameters:
      ResultType - The type of result to be returned
      Parameters:
      query - The DBUtil.Query object to use for the query
      Returns:
      The result from the query
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • executeQuery

      public <ResultType> ResultType executeQuery​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String sql, com.github.tadukoo.util.functional.function.ThrowingFunction<java.sql.ResultSet,​ResultType,​java.sql.SQLException> convertFromResultSet) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Executes a sql query after building a DBUtil.Query object for it from the given pieces. Returns the result of the query.
      Type Parameters:
      ResultType - The type of result to be returned
      Parameters:
      name - The name to use for the query (for debugging purposes - may be null)
      sql - The sql query string to run
      convertFromResultSet - The ThrowingFunction to use to run the query
      Returns:
      The result from the query
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

      public <ResultType> ResultType doSearch​(com.github.tadukoo.util.functional.function.ThrowingFunction<java.sql.ResultSet,​ResultType,​java.sql.SQLException> convertFromResultSet, java.lang.String returnPieces, java.lang.String mainTable, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> otherTables, java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> junctions, java.lang.String[] intArgs, int[] intValues, boolean[] partialStrings, java.lang.String[] stringArgs, java.lang.String[] stringValues) throws java.sql.SQLException

    • executeUpdates

      public boolean executeUpdates​(DBUtil.Updates updates) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Executes sql updates and returns if they were a success.
      Parameters:
      updates - The DBUtil.Updates object to use for the updates
      Returns:
      If it succeeded or not
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • executeUpdates

      public boolean executeUpdates​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> names, java.util.List<java.lang.String> sqls) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Executes sql updates and returns if they were a success. This version builds the DBUtil.Updates object using the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      names - The names to use for the updates (optional - used for debugging)
      sqls - The sql update statements to run
      Returns:
      If it succeeded or not
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • executeUpdate

      public boolean executeUpdate​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String sql) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Executes a single sql update and returns if it was a success. This version sends the name and statement to the plural version to create the DBUtil.Updates object.
      Parameters:
      name - The name to use for the update (optional - used for debugging)
      sql - The sql update statement to run
      Returns:
      If it succeeded or not
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
